The following quick settings require the device to be unlocked before you can interact with them:\nAirplane, Battery saver, Bluetooth, Cellular, Data saver, Hotspot, Internet, NFC, Rotation lock, and Wi-Fi
Display seconds next to clock in status bar

Must be in DateFormat eg. MM/dd/yy

Full → empty: red ← green ← blue ← red

Spoof the device storage encryption status to \'Encrypted\'

Spoof the device as different models for select games to unlock higher FPS
Spoof the device as Pixel 2 for Snapchat to allow original quality captures
Hide screen capture and screen record status from all applications. Can be convenient in some cases but may lead to privacy leaks. Need to restart applications for the change to take effect.
Inverts the layout of the navigation bar and other items, such as the IME switcher
Enable to display logo in the status bar

Display an animation when the device is plugged in

Smart pixels is a power saving feature. Depending on how many pixels you decide to turn off, you could see improvement in battery life. Note that in some cases it can result in unresponsive areas on touch screen
Save battery by shutting off extra pixels
Shut off pixels to reduce power consumption
Enable Smart Pixels when battery saver is enabled
Prevents burn-in on OLED devices by shifting pixels every so often
Quickly disable heads up for all apps but keep them enabled for dialer and messaging apps
Disable heads up notifications in these applications
Disable heads up from these applications
Peeking notifications will show for %d seconds
Swiping up on peeking notifications will snooze heads up from that application for 1 minute
Swiping up on peeking notifications will snooze heads up from that application for %d minutes
Display heads-up notification in IOS \'Dynamic Island\' style
Display currently playing song in Dynamic Island style

The Island notification feature, inspired by iOS's Dynamic Island, transforms Android's heads-up notifications into quick-access and compact notification utility.

Island Quick Access Controls includes the following features:
1. Tap island notification to quick answer phone calls.
2. Long press island notification to reject phone calls.
3. Long press island notification to expand the island notification preview.
Remove the 15GiB file size limit\nMay result in a larger than needed output file
Blocks all apps from setting the wallpaper dim\nForces dim to 0
